fields.name: SIH
fields.organizers: SIH [Gov of India] Ministry of Ayush
fields.problemStatement:
• Need Instructor & Calm environment Solution: A virtual reality device can be made which features different modes of Tratak like spot, candle etc.
  • This device will help in better concentration as it provides soothing environment.
  • Yogasana can be performed well in this environment. The VR Experience should be smooth.
  • VR software requirement: The VR Experience should be able to provide the virtual tour inside the yoga hall. The participant should be able to move around and do Yogasana.
fields.aboutCompetition: Smart India Hackathon is a nationwide initiative to provide students a platform to solve some of pressing problems we face in our daily lives, and thus inculcate a culture of product innovation and a mindset of problem solving.
fields.solution:
• Lightweight and durable Headset - designed with flexible material and cotton cushion padding.
  • Next Gen Lenses - offering a wide field of view with significantly reduced glare for crystal-clear HD optics.
  • LRPF filters, Inter-pupillary distance adjuster - provides eye protection and drastically improves vision clarity.
  • Inbuilt Spatial Audio - discover a new dimension in sound through our integrated speakers.
  • Pulse rate monitoring - keep check of your pulse and temperature.
  • Controller-less VR - no additional devices, such as controllers or wires, required.
  • Interactive Virtual Tutor - to assist you, with voice, through your yoga experience.
  • Gaze interaction - move through VR application with just your eyes.
  • Gyroscopic walk - with just a 30’ head tilt to walk through the environment and experience a safe, Total Virtual Reality of 360’.
  • 3D Virtual Buttons - for easy interaction and control with VR environment and characters.
  • Simple UI - to ensure a user-friendly experience for all ages.

fields.name: TCS_XR_Pro
fields.aboutCompetition: Connect is the flagship event of CII supported by the Gov of Tamil Nadu and Software Technology Parks of India, Ministry of Electronics and Telecommunications, and Gov of India.
fields.solution:
The potential of AR systems for can be classified into three groups: Object, model and human. The Objects are all the non-human realworld assets (workpieces, tools, environment.). The Model contains all the virtual assets (process model, documentation, design drawings). The
Human is the Student to be supported by the AR system. The AR provides an enhanced interface between digital data and human, due to improved
visualization and controls. The objects will be actual 3D models viewed by the student made of model with lighting and animation Its simply the
model with Animation, Lighting and User Interface. The model will be a CAD model of a specific BASE TARGET, documentation, design
drawing. Human will be eliminated in this context as the entire process can be automated. The AR model can be further used to train human
workers by creating virtual models of different objects and adding the technical specifications and various functionals.
SOLIDWORKS is used to design a 3D model and then the model is exported in FBX format. FBX format of the model is then imported
in MAYA and the required animation in given the model and again the model is exported in FBX format with the animation and the model is kept
imported in UNITY 3D.By using VUFORIA an AR Tool Kit the base target(using image) or Ground Target(using ground) or User Defined Target
(using any base target) for devices that does not support Ground detection. The programming for the application is done using VISUAL STUDIO
the program used is C# developed by Microsoft. All of these is imported separately in same project in Unity 3D andAPK is developed using
Android SDK and Android Studio.
